Rarity: Super Rare

Waldo Arms
EQUIP: ANY. UNEQUIP: DROP. EFFECT: Giant Reach: 2. At the beginning of your turn, you may roll a d6. This character has the listed effect until your next turn. 1-2: Modify Attack and Defense +1. 3-4: Incapacitate as FREE. 5-6: FREE: Make a close attack. Heavy Object.
10 Points

February 11, 2022
Thunderwebs
So your force at the start of the game is not your starting force, cause that's not confusing. The fact that equipment that is on your character at the START of the game but somehow is not part of your STARTING force is poor language choice on Wizkids part due to a weird timing issue (that issue being your starting force is when you build your team, not when you start the game). All that said, it does appear that this is a way around the unique rule, so I stand corrected.
February 10, 2022
Coyote's Own
@ Thudnderwebb You can have one unique element on your starting force, but elements from outside the game (like those that character starting the game equipped with) are not part of your starting force.
February 10, 2022
Skeleman
[QUOTE]No, you CANNOT have 2. All objects other than standard light or heavy are special objects. Equipment is a sub-set of special objects. Special objects are all unique, therefore you may only have one of each on your force (which includes your sideline). Per section 25.1 of the comprehensive rulebook, although it's actually been this way for YEARS.[/QUOTE] This is incorrect. Items that start the game equipped to a character do not count towards item limits.
July 11, 2021
Thunderwebs
[QUOTE=Retroforce;12071589]Can you have both Superior Spider-Man and Iron Spider each start the same game with this if you have 2?[/QUOTE] No, you CANNOT have 2. All objects other than standard light or heavy are special objects. Equipment is a sub-set of special objects. Special objects are all unique, therefore you may only have one of each on your force (which includes your sideline). Per section 25.1 of the comprehensive rulebook, although it's actually been this way for YEARS.
